title: José Soto (Peruvian footballer)
text:
José Alberto "Pepe" Soto Gómez (born January 11, 1970 in <a href="Lima">Lima</a>) is a <a href="Peruvian%20people">Peruvian</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">manager</a> and former player. Nicknamed "Pepe," he played as a <a href="Defender%20%28football%29">central defender</a> and spent the majority of his playing career with <a href="Alianza%20Lima">Alianza Lima</a>. He is currently the manager of <a href="Juan%20Aurich">Juan Aurich</a>.
Club career.
Soto started his club career with <a href="Club%20Centro%20Deportivo%20Municipal">Deportivo Municipal</a> in 1987. He also played for <a href="Sporting%20Cristal">Sporting Cristal</a> and <a href="Alianza%20Lima">Alianza Lima</a> in Peru.
Soto spent several seasons playing in <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, joining <a href="Puebla%20F.C.">Puebla</a> in the Invierno 1996 season and remaining with the club until 1998. He also represented <a href="Club%20Celaya">Celaya</a> during 1999 and 2000.
International career.
Soto obtained 75 international caps for the <a href="Peru%20national%20football%20team">Peru national team</a>, scoring three goals. He made his debut on November 25, 1992 in a 1-1 draw against Ecuador, and played his last international match at age 33 in a World Cup qualifying defeat against Chile on September 9, 2003. Soto's international career included the Copa América tournaments of <a href="1993%20Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica">1993</a>, <a href="1995%20Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica">1995</a>, <a href="1999%20Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica">1999</a>, and <a href="2001%20Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica">2001</a>.
Coaching career.
On December 17, 2011, Soto was appointed head manager of <a href="Alianza%20Lima">Alianza Lima</a> for the start of the <a href="2012%20Torneo%20Descentralizado">2012 Torneo Descentralizado</a> season.
Personal life.
Has a son named Jose Soto and a daughter named Maria Soto. The mother of his children is Monica De La Jara. He is also the older brother of <a href="Jorge%20Soto%20%28footballer%29">Jorge Soto</a> and <a href="Giancarlo%20Soto">Giancarlo Soto</a>.
